intro: Cienfuegosia sulfurea, commonly known as the sulfur-flower cienfuegosia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It is characterized by its yellowish-gold flowers that bloom in clusters, giving it a striking appearance. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments, often near water bodies. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
